info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 8:54PM EDT until July 02 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion Mecklenburg County. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain had ended across the advised area, but rain gages were showing as much as 3 inches of rain had fallen west of Huntersville. Locales in this area, west of I-77, will see a gradual improvement in high water conditions through late evening, but rising stream levels throughout the McDowell Creek basin is still likely. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Cornelius, Ramsey Creek Park, Lake Norman and Croft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
